items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Further rainfall is forecast with isolated heavy showers this afternoon, Friday and over the weekend. 
We continue to monitor the situation. We are checking the condition of defences
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. .

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are fluctuating on the River Kennet but are generally stable and should begin to fall again soon. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Isolated heavy rain and thundery showers are forecast for today and over the weekend. We expect river levels to begin falling again this afternoon 25/06/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 26/06/2021, or as the situation changes.
